Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tattuck
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel in a primarily business area. There is literally nothing around, apart from some office buildings. It takes 15-20 minutes to walk to Dubai Marina and 10-15 minutes to metro station. Rooms are good but not spectacular - unfortunately in mine the wi-fi did not work and I was forced to use LAN cable (the Internet was free). Breakfast was very good though. The hotel is very reasonably priced, considering quality and not so bad location (considering Dubai distances).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to metro, nice rooms, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: al_advisor82
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a business trip. Breakfast was amazing, dinner at Certo was also very good and the environment was very good. The Business center, a special lounge area for business travelers, was really worth visiting! You can have any coffee or beverages or even some drinks (beers, wines) without any extra money. Pistachios and some other similar kinds are also for free.

Reviews.Title: “Good if u have business in this area”
Reviews.Author: carlos d
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks in feb. 2012 so i pretty much tried everything in it,let's start with it's location which is not a good thing if u r looking for some night life or even sight seeing because it locates in (media city) which is full of companies like CNN and MICROSOFT so if u want to go any place at night u have to take a taxi for a long ride but if u r there for business like i was u,it will be perfect for u, the room is good,clean and really friendly stuff with a smile every where, the food is good too,a lot of choices and this includes the breakfast,diner and lunch. they have a nice cafe in the roof with good band but like i said not a lot of people. the wi fi is good but in some rooms the signal is not full so u have to be close to the door of ur room. if u r a smoker u have to ask for a smoking room bcuz they r strictly about smoking in non smoking room. i enjoyed it but the location was just the issue although i had business there .

Reviews.Title: “Flash and slick just like the city”
Reviews.Author: Joma71
Reviews.Content: Just what you would expect in Dubai...new, slick and well equipped. Great room albeit quite small...all the mod cons and very comfortable. However the real attraction is the roof top bar...great place to sink a couple and watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “All you need as business traveller”
Reviews.Author: SummerGB
Reviews.Content: The business rooms provide a lot of space and all amenities you need as business traveller. Flawless free of charge WiFi, coffee machine in the room, huge king size bed, fresh fruits, complimentary bottled water etc. The hotel itself provides bar, restaurants, and all the usual facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better for a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyinOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: I spent two days here. My first issue was that they did not have enough staff on reception. I had to wait what seemed like an age to get someone to check me in. This also presented problems. My visit was for business we had booked a meeting room and this is where I took real issue. The meeting room had been booked by the office. A few mistakes were made by the office with regards to timings. I had wanted to have our food that had been ordered in the same room and at the start of the meeting - 1pm as opposed to 3pm that the office requested. First of all i had to plead that they serve the food at 1pm. I had to be put through to some manager who eventually got the kitchen to agree to the time change. 1pm came and went and there was no food. I had to keep coming out to speak to the waiter and the elusive manager on the phone. Rather than continue to bore you with the detail I again had to plead to ask that the food be brought on to the meeting room. Food that had been ready at 1pm eventually got to us at 2.38 pm! Obviously some items were cold. The manager on the phone said the waiter could not take instruction from me as he was "only a waiter". Surely in a business centre there should have been someone that could issue instructions. All the issues led to me having to come out of my meeting about 5 times - not good. I could go on but they really need to improve the way they handle customers. Yes we got things wrong with the booking but they were not insurmountable issues. I also deal with customers and they make mistakes but the mark of good service to my mind is how you handle things when things go wrong. On a positive note I really liked the Italian restaurant - great service and food. Probably where we got the best service. Rooms are ok. Breakfast not bad. Location is good if you are visiting a nearby company. Not one I would recommend to a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Business area”
Reviews.Author: thanksmate
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly and well run Hotel, in a business (media) area. Not bad Value on Dubai terms Internet was fats, meals excellent , staff very friendly and helpfull. Location not to bad, as fairly central and taxis are cheap in dubai anyway.We had a family with 3 rooms, beds comfortable - ppol area great for Kids. No Views to speak off , and no shops close by, however i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Amanda V
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here overnight recently - my husband and I live in Abu Dhabi, and we did not want to make the trip back from Dubai late at night when we had activities planned in Dubai the next morning. The hotel is well located, and there is no shortage of cabs, which was useful for us. The bedrooms are small but perfect for short stays, and the bed - while smaller than those in most hotels - very comfortable. The bedroom windows have blinds that completely block out the light, which is great for that extra bit of sleep after a scorching Arabian sun rises (at 5am in summer). The bathroom was also perfect for a short stay. As a couple, the room might get a bit cramped for a stay of more than a few nights. It is probably aimed at a business market - i.e. one person per room, in which case it is just right. The breakfast was good - although not outstanding, and the coffees excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. It is a business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SerGioDubai
Reviews.Content: I lived in Dubai 3 years and this is the best business hotel in my opinion. Fantstic location, right in the hearth of Marina, but still out of the too busy JBR walk. It is walking distance form the One & Only superluxury complex. 8 minutes drive to Mall of Emirates. It is directly connected to the two main city transportation axis. The italian restaurant Certo is one of the most authentic in town and with great value for money. The hotel has a nice little spa, busy popular roof top bar and sport bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Non Smokers: go to another place”
Reviews.Author: luismparis
Reviews.Content: If you are a non smoker, beware. Even with a confirmed reservation for a non smoking room, you may have to sleep in a room with strong odors from people that smoke in the room. This is specially likely if you arrive in Dubai in one of the late night flights, arriving from Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel in Media City”
Reviews.Author: TBuzz
Reviews.Content: Radisson Blu is a good choice for a budget conscious business traveller. The rooms are well laid out, although they are a little smaller than what one might expect in Dubai. The location is good if your work takes you to Media City or the Marina. The food is great - I strongly recommend the Italian restaurant Certo. The pool is a little small - and there isn't much to do in the evenings. However, it is close to several beach clubs, so you would need to make a short walk to Le Meridien and The Westin

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, average price, average overall”
Reviews.Author: S6blr
Reviews.Content: I got in 2300 from London and was surprised there was no food available which was a shame given the droll food on the BA flight. The hotel location was fine for co-workers to collect me, get a taxi from/to, etc. The bedding is average comfort, the bathrooms average I guess I would stay here again. The breakfast was not bad although the staff weren't that friendly but for a Radisson it was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guysingle
Reviews.Content: Good hotel if you are visiting on business and your company is based in Media city. Nothing much else around presently so I wouldn't choose to come back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business - otherwise bland”
Reviews.Author: doogo
Reviews.Content: Media City is located between Dubai city and Jebel Ali - so not really a place a tourist would choose to stay. The Radisson Blu is the quintessential business hotel - friendly but cold front desk, clean and efficient bar, rooms etc. but nothing to write home about. The location in Media City is effectively a work-in-progress (like a lot of Dubai). In short, if you are working in Media City, this isa good hotel to stay in. If you are visiting Dubai as a tourist, stay somewhere closer to the sea, the Dubai Mall or Creek.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for business”
Reviews.Author: farmerboyNorthants
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while out on business, I found that I ended up heading out every evening as the bar and restaurants wasn't that busy and I wanted to experience everything that Dubai has to offer. Rooms are well appointed and the staff were very friendly. However next time I will just stay near the key attractions or beach front location. This hotel is located in the heart of the business district so there isn't much else around there, the pool is small and over looked by the surrounding offices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for a business trip - clean, comfortable & friendly”
Reviews.Author: J91000
Reviews.Content: I always at the Radisson Blu in Dubai because it's close to the offices in Media / Internet city, and is incredibly accommodating. The staff respond quickly, the rooms are comfortable, and the pool-side roof terrace is a lovely place to relax at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: Visioncoach001
Reviews.Content: I found the room to be very small, and since the rooftop was just above me it was very noisy.Service is amazing here especially in the banquet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel for Media City”
Reviews.Author: HentiCat
Reviews.Content: Spending a week here and the rooms are good, the restaurant has a reasonable buffet. The staff are friendly (but that's normal for Dubai) and the business lounge has free drinks and nice nibbles throughout the day. The sports bar is quiet downstairs and outrageously smokey upstairs - it's like stepping back into the 1990s before the ban in the UK. Internet is a bit iffy but that could just be the local telco. Other than that a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service, really for business not vacation”
Reviews.Author: dragek
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days on business and have to say, spot on. Staff were very helpful and very polite, nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were a decent size and have everything you need including great Nespresso coffee! The gym has two pools, one on top deck. these are small but enough to relax by and to cool off in. It also has a gym, which wasn't large, but good enough for a work out. I upgraded to use the exec lounge, once again staff very good, food was a good spread and nice selection of drinks. I ate once in the restaurant, very nice food although a little pricey. And lastly a bar on top of the second tower, which was good to relax in. Well worth the money, one of the better Dubai business hotels!

Reviews.Title: “For the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: IamFromNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a 2-week business trip. My company booked this hotel for me so that I could simply walk to my office every single day. The view from the hotel room is -- of course, office buildings around Media City. The hotel was clean, the room itself was just the right size. I would usually take the cab to the tourist spots & malls, which wasn't bad as it was a short drive to every spot I wanted to see. The staff was helpful. The restaurant food could have been a little better, but it wasn't bad. If I was on a vacation/leisure trip -- I would go to a hotel by the beach where I could walk out from the hotel and stroll the shops/beach. By the way, DUBAI is a great place to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business - not good for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: lukeskywalker_fi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the business centre, thus do not consider it for a holiday destination. Rooms are a little small, but well equiped. The hotel consists of 2 towers and its a very long journey if you happen to be in the west tower to the breakfast in the East tower. You have two seperate lift journeys and a long walk across abridge between the two. The pool is a token pool and with a total of about 12 sun bed the whole are is very small - and has no view whatsoever - other than an office building. Gym is good. Resturants are good(very good Italian) - staff helpfull, and very easy to get a taxi etc. The bar is filled with journalists form the nearby offices - and is loud and lively.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely business-trip friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fred_by_the_world
Reviews.Content: If you are on business trip and need to be at Dubai Internet City or Jumeirah Lake Towers, this is the place. Ask for the extra-charge for the business class room and you'll have the opportunity to enjoy the business class lounge with free drinks and food all day long - extremely useful when your flight is late at night and already checked out. Very good value for money if you are on business trip but avoid if you are there for leisure (small swimming pool, not conveniently located)

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: Rashid_Nizamani
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and clean. The staff are great and very welcoming, the rooms are nice, great showers, LCD TV, free internet...etc. Its located in a very good place, I really enjoyed the pool area. It's a bit far from the city center & other areas so we had to take taxi to go see other attractions/places. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: arhipbogdan28
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Radisson for 4 days and overall I would rate it as a good exprience. Very good breakfast - a lot of choices. The room was not that big but anyway I did not spent a lot of time there. The bed was super confortable and big. If you are in town with business it's a very good location because it's very close to the Internet City. For vacation I would recommend a hotel closer to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “NOT HAPPY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TarekTraveling
Reviews.Content: My 1st time in Radisson Blu (Bubai): I asked for an Iron this morning. I plugged it in and started to iron. The iron literally BURNED a whole in my POLO shirt. There was something sticky on it from before and melted through my shirt when i plugged it in (from the heat). I explained & showed management what happened. THEY DIDN'T BELIEVE ME! They said that i turned on the switch all the way (made it too hot), but i didn't. This is not the 1st time i iron my shirt. Not happy with the way this was handled. I can buy another shirt, it's not about that, It's about them not believing what a customer says. As am typing this am looking at a sign on my desk that says "100% Guest Satisfaction GUARANTEE". Not really believing that at this point!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, super food, could improve sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: uksa
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Cleanliness and funtionality are really important to me, and the room was clean and everything worked - and the extra bits & pieces in the bathroom are nice. Also the tea & coffee tray. The wi-fi was great, the meals and restaurants were really great, and the staff were all helpful and friendly. I was attending a 4-day company meeting and our meeting organiser told me that the hotel was exceptionally helpful in the preparation and set-up of the meeting. I have only one complaint - the truly horrendous noise on Thursday night. The music (either from the bar or terrace) was so loud my room shook - until 2am. When I checked out I was asked if I had enjoyed my stay and said that I had enjoyed everything except for the noise. This got a quick apology and a note on my "hotel record" to say that I should be in the east tower the next time (I was in the west tower on the 2nd floor - the bar is on the 7th floor!). Somone I didn't know was checking out at the same time and heard this and said that he also could not sleep because of the noise. When I discussed this with my colleagues later, one of them said that he had requested as quiet a room as possible on check-in, but was placed on the 6th floor of the west tower immediately under the bar and could not sleep the first night. He was moved on his request the next day. I would go back to this hotel, but only if I could be guaranteed a quieter room when I booked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: FlibFlob
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work so I see many hotels. However, this is the first time (for work) I've been motivated to write about one on TripAdvisor. Firstly, it terms of 'features' there is nothing particularly special about the hotel in comparison to the majority of business hotels. BUT, somehow it manages to lift itself above the crop. The service is attentive whilst not interfering, the 'feeling' of the place is nice and I have to say the value is very good. Maybe I was lucky on the rate but rarely are so many amenities available on a package that costs just 180 EUR a night. The food is excellent, rooms spacious and bathrooms very good (separate bath/shower and bidet). Free, very fast internet, free DVD rental and almost all hour access to an all-complimentary business lounge - what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: svensktiger
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 1 night as my nr #1 choice in the Marina was sold out 1st night of my stay. Paid almost the same as the hotel I shifted to -- and was such change in class -- to the better. In essence, I had expected more. Got a room in the west tower which was a walk quite far away from reception area. Had a horrible experience with a too persistent bellboy upon arrival. Small, crowded room. Good thing with Radisson is the complimentary wifi -- regardless where. That and breakfast on the plus side. It took an eternity to check out. Hotel is all ok, but I would simply not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice for business trips to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: ameirah
Reviews.Content: On my business trips to Dubai, the Radisson is my number 1 choice. It is 5 mins away from most IT companies, and about a 15 min taxi ride to the Mall of the Emirates for some quick shopping in between conferences. No need to go to downtown. The breakfast buffet is superb! The service is excellent. The rooms and corridors are a little cramped, but it serves the purpose and are immaculate. Room service menu needs a bigger variety, i suggest to grab some dinner before going back to the hotel. Overall excellent, I am one satisfied customer and will continue to go to the Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Mark-choosy-chappy
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The pick up at the airport was a little rusty (they kept me waiting while they found a car and then they had to disappear to pay the parking - at 02:00 in the morning after a long flight - and VERY long queues for immigration & that was the so called fast Track - this can be a drag) Check in was super fast The room was very well laid out Quiet room Comfortable bed Well presented food at breakfast A professional team The car back to the airport went like clockwork I would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Taito30
Reviews.Content: Perfect service Friendly and knowledgable staff Clean & relaxed atmosphere Location Food was delicious and perfect! This place has my vote...will be going back there definately.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round stay!”
Reviews.Author: RobMichaela
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to many hotels around the world and this one ranks high up the top of our list and if we go to Dubai again we will return. The reception staff were warm and welcoming, the food in the restaurants was very good and the room service was quick and very tasty! We couldnt find a fault with it, modern, clean, plush and very close to metro station and central Dubai. Radisson Blu is now one of my favourite brands and this is down to the staff and their excellent service and hotel facilities. Keep up the good work Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a pleasant stay at a modern, well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: halfbrilliant
Reviews.Content: I was in Dubai for one week in January 2011 and stayed at the Radisson Blue, Media City. I found the hotel to be clean, modern and well located. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The en-suite bathroom featured tempered glass shower screen, marble floor coverings and granite vanity unit worktops. The room itself boasted air conditioning, desk, flat screen tv and good views. We only ate in the restaurant for breakfast which had a good selection of food for all palates including a pork option. The roof top bar was novel with spectacular views and not too expensive for beer. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: millyomuk
Reviews.Content: With the huge number of hotels in Dubai I know it is often very difficult to choose where to stay. Last year and again this year, my husband and I and our two grown up children stayed at The Raddison Blu during the Dubai Marathon weekend at the end of January. The hotel is perfectly located as you can walk to the start line within 5 minutes. We upgraded our rooms this year and that was well worth the extra expense. The rooms and bathrooms were really nice and we had the use of the business lounge with free drinks and finger food. We were away from the upstairs bar which was rather noisy last year ( although staff very kindly changed our rooms on request) so we had a very quiet stay. We only ate breakfast at the hotel and that was most enjoyable with a menu to suit all tastes. The staff were most helpful and polite. We had a most enjoyable stay so we will certainly be staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special; not customer-focused”
Reviews.Author: Molepolole
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights whilst attending a conference at the hotel. Like many other European guests, my flight got in early in the morning and I arrived a the hotel at 10.30. Not surprisingly perhaps, the hotel could not let me into my room, even though we had been promised immediate check-in. Apparently they had been full the night before. But, if so, why did they promise immediate check-in? What I did find surprising was that I was expected to sit in the hotel lobby for as many hours as it took for the staff to find me a room. There appeared to be no system for dealing with early arrivals such as myself (separate seating area, snacks, a shower...). I waited for 2 hours and only got into a room by harassing the over-worked front desk staff. There was no acknowledgement by any manager that I had received a less than satisfactory welcome. My room was very small by Dubai hotel standards but otherwise okay. My room safe malfunctioned (with my passport etc inside it) on the last morning. Someone came and fixed it but, rightly, I had to be in the room and thus had to leave the conference at a time when I needed to be there. Again, no apologies from anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel excellent vacation :-)”
Reviews.Author: Alekb62
Reviews.Content: Hello to everyone who intend to go to Dubai and big hello to all people who are working in this hotel who were so friendly ! I just came from Dubai, I stayed with my 22 old daughter in this hotel for 8 days and we enjoyed very much, much more than we expected and we are very exigent. Everything was so good and well done: the service, the people, so kindly, so amiably, smiling. The room very clean, well equipment, the breakfast various. It was a lovely escape from the ordinary life, I will recommend to everyone. We had a fantastic trip ! Dubai is amazing !

Reviews.Title: “My number 1 in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Davids86
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel three times now, I'm more than convinced - it's awesome! Beautiful building, spacious and beautifully decorated rooms with great beds (I slept like a baby each night), every amenity possible and most of all, an amazing staff. What a great team! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Dubai, whether on business or leisure. I look forward to my fourth visit this March, and hope to see all your smiling faces again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: mia2002_11
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed here with my partner, we got to the hotel and everything was perfect, the staff were very friendly and helpfull and our trip was perfect. I will definatly be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: sylvestor186
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the size, quality and amenities in the room. I upgraded to the business exec floor and it was most definitely worth the cost. It included the business lounge, wifi and gym. Room was super spacious and very accomodating for working.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: cmtsuigolf
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location in the Dubai Internet City and convenience to the office. Not disappointed at all. Friendly lobby reception staff. Rooms are very proper and clean, just everything you need as a business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “silent review”
Reviews.Author: ValeryK
Reviews.Content: just put four stars in my assessment... no need to say more

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a trip to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: thegrahams2001
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I visited Dubai for a weeks break. The chose of hotels in Dubai is amazing so I relied on Trip Advisor. I decided to stay at Radisson Blu, Media City. This hotel was outstanding thanks to the staff, facilities and location. Several write ups state this hotel is for business travelers only which is totally wrong. We arrived at 09:00 from the UK and our room was ready, not only that we were upgraded. The front office staff could not do enough for us, so after a quick shower we were on the 8th floor sun deck, enjoying the sun. After a brief discussion with the hotels Concierge we decided on our plan of attack regarding sightseeing. The Concierge pointed us in the direction giving us handy hints. The hotel offers shuttle services to several of Dubai's attractions including The Mall of the Emirates. We utilized the shuttle service on a couple of occasions which enabled us to familiarize ourselves with the area. The hotel also offers day passes to a nearby beach club which we also utilized; this beach club was amazing, not over crowded like several of the other local beaches, quiet, beautiful swimming, good bar and restaurant. After a few days we discovered Dubai Marina was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel, the walk is also through some beautiful parks. In fact there are several nice parks in the surrounding area, which surprised me, we enjoyed walks through most of them in the beautiful Dubai weather. Walking was no problem because this has to be one of the safest cities I have visited. Taxi's to all the major attractions such as Buj Al Arab, Atlantis, Wild Wadi, Souk Madinat from the hotel were about £3 (20 Dinar). The hotels location is away from down town but trust me this is much better, when you do the us trip you will see enough of down town. The services within the hotel were outstanding, breakfast was superb, the Italian restaurant was different class, the spa was top drawer, and the bedrooms have outstanding black out screens, which means you can sleep a bit longer but that’s what a holiday is for. The 8 days we spent in Dubai were superb thanks to the staff at Radisson Blu Media City; we thoroughly enjoyed our trip and will definitely be back. After several trips being spoilt by poor hotels and poor staff it was refreshing to choose a hotel that was brilliant Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and efficient”
Reviews.Author: TheMuscatFox
Reviews.Content: I arrived 9am and although the check-in time was 2pm they let me have my room straightaway - a good start, why don't all hotels do this? I was meeting companies in DIC so the location was spot on, they were within walking distance even in the Dubai heat. The hotel rooms are in two towers, so if you are in the West one you need to get the lift to 2nd floor, walk across a walkway and then get into a second lift. The business centre was excellent and the staff were helpful as ever. The rooms were on the cosy side, for a solo business trip they were ideal although I would have wanted something bigger if my partner was travelling with me. I had booked B&B, due to my early flight departures I never sampled breakfast as the restaurant doesn't open until 6.30am. Excellent free coffee/pastries in the reception area at 5am were most welcome. A typical Dubai business hotel that I would definitely stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Provides all the business basics you need”
Reviews.Author: eelnoj
Reviews.Content: 8 night first time stay during Ramadan... the proximity to the office was the key determinor for why this hotel was chosen vs many other hotels in Dubai. Lobby staff: Ok. Restaurant (Chef's House): Complimentary breakfast has good service and a good selection. Wait staff are prompt and friendly. Iftar buffet in the evening was surprisingly good for the entrees, desserts were sufficient. Room: Decently sized and appointed. Could use a bit more drawer space, although request for more hangers was quick and easy. Decent shower, no bath.. and I wasn't fond of the scent of the in-house bathing products.. had to go out and buy something simpler. Wireless internet in the room was ok, unlike other hotels elsewhere. Gym: Barely basic and could have been cooler inside. Not very large open area so might fit 3 at most if you needed to do a free workout off the machines. Has a decent change room with lockers and the furnishings and accessories are good. Pool: Was not used as it was Ramadan, but would be relatively small. Bars/etc: The hotel has a few other bars/eateries as it has both a west & east tower. I did try the sports bar on the 2nd floor and it was alright. Overall, a decent business travel hotel providing the basics for ~USD110 (corp rate). If you want more amenities/luxuries then try the hotels along the beach 3 blocks away, or altogether out of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with decent service”
Reviews.Author: SlartibarfastLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in May and was very pleased. I was even able to check into the room at 9 am for no extra charge. The room is nice and clean, it is fairly quiet. The food is just excellent. If you have an executive room the lounge is great. I have been to many business hotels and must say that this one delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Dubai”
Reviews.Author: pranayshankar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit expensive looking at room size but the amenties are excellent, located within dubai media city was a treat to be there. Only problem was india food not being served all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: ABloem
Reviews.Content: Not sure you'd want to go here for leisure (it's not close to any of the sights or beach). However, as a business hotel, it's excellent. Comfortable rooms, good service (prompt cleaning service, 24/7 room service with good food, etc.). The only drawback is that the rooftop pool is only open during business hours, so I've never been there; the spa's pool is open till 10pm, but a bit small for doing laps ;) If you're sensitive about noise, though, don't get a room in the West Tower (or at least not on the higher floors), the rooftop bar can be noisy, with a DJ and intoxicated Brits till 2am. The hotel was kind enough to get guests a voucher for a free drink at the rooftop bar to compensate for the noise, however, I'd have preferred to get some sleep :P Note that this is mostly an issue on a Thursday night (which, of course, is Dubai's first night of the weekend). And maybe you'd love to go up and party with the crowd ;)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: adamsw
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is in the hard of the Media City, very close to where the main software companies have their offices in Dubai. Also close to the shore and one of the Palms. Travel from airport is like 30mins by car which is ok. The hotel has a very good quality and std. of the rooms and service. I recommend to have an upgrade to a business room which also includes the business lounge at 2nd floor for nice beverages and snacks in the afternoon. Plus late checkout which helps a lot as usually flights back to Europe are at late night.

Reviews.Title: “Run baby run! worst business hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: SoloArabian
Reviews.Content: the rooms are not that clean! you will see bed sheet with lipstick and what have you.. I put a piece of paper (theirs) on the bed to signify to room service that I wish to have the bed sheets replaced, but they rarely do! I first stayed at a room close to the street nearby which i eventually had to flee because of the noise, but guess what, the business class room that I was transferred to was smelly, i had to ask them to spray it a lil... and the pillows had stains on them!! terrible !! the only pros of this hotel are, first , the free good internet service. secondly, is the business lounge, it's quite good.. and finally the great italian restaurant in the next building..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: neveratrest
Reviews.Content: It makes a great change to write a good review about a hotel. I stay away for far too many nights every year. Most of the hotels I stay in are okay and a few really awful. This hotel is excellent. I recommend it. Food in the Italian Certo restaurant is very good with excellent thin pizza. Service is prompt and very polite. Rooms are clean, comfortable and beds are very comfy.Good location for Internet City and Media City. Having tried a few hotels in Dubai I would recommend this and the Festival City Intercon/Crown. This is as good but better priced. I will be returning here without question.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: scunnybunnyAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on business in a standard room which is fine for solo traveller but would be a touch small for a couple. Good shower, clean room with free internet. Good breakfast. Staff v friendly, good service. The only down side was having a room on the 7th floor directly beneath the roof top bar. This was not a problem early in the week but towards the end of the week the noise was unbearable and the management clearly recognised that there was a problem as I was given a voucher for a free drink for any inconvenience. On the final night as I had an early flight and needed to sleep I asked to change rooms. They were v accomodating and moved me to a business class room but if the hotel had been full this would have been a real problem. I will stay here again but not on the 7th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very neat, enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Melika969
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Dubai for business and I stayed in this hotel for 4 days.This hotel offers you great service and very very clean and organized rooms. You can get everything you want from a luxury hotel. If I want to go to Dubai again, for sure my first choice will be Radisson. Well it is far from the center of the city, but as my company based in internet city, for me it was a 5 minute walk. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: travel_hyd
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here. The facility was quite good and conference facilities and support was superb. Only challenge was acoustics of the room - it was a challenge to hear everybody. Food was good and lots of it during the day while the conference was on. Rooms were nice and confortable. Cleanliness was superb throughout the property. Hotel staff were very nice and supportive, always trying to find a way to take care of your needs. All in all, a very good experience as long as you can manage the fact that this is far from the main city.

Reviews.Title: “First of all the hotel left me at the...”
Reviews.Author: Englishrose1982
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel left me at the airport we had previosly agreed to a pick up at the airport which they did not fullfil. I found some one who worked for the airport at the airport who rang the hotel they then said because of this they would pay for a taxi from the airport to the hotel which they did not. After travelling for 24 hours and the local time been 2am I had enough and just went to bed. Pool dissapointing. But theist dissapointing was the level of service this is Dubai and you expect to be treated perfectly and they did not.the place was over priced I have stayed in Dubai before on jumeriah beach and it was a better location,and cheaper I have also stayed at atlantas the only one that dissapointed me was the radisson.the other thing i would like to add was they make you pay some money incase you use anything which I didn't so they refunded the money in cash in local currency which was stupid as I was gettin on a plane I had paid via card so it made nonsense.when I checked out they never asked if I had a pleasant stay they where rude very rude.

Reviews.Title: “best blackout system ever!! and no kids (at least i didn't spot any)”
Reviews.Author: Elsoueidi
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel for business people. It's in a convenient location and quiet area. I was there for one night cause I had a party to attend and i live in abu dhabi. The staff arranged a taxi for me and made sure I was at the venue in time. I had great room service at 3am in the morning and you can't hear an explosion even if it was outside your door. Decoration is fantastic and very modern. The shower is GREAT!! spacious and feels good. Food was great and rich portions. Friendly staff and very accomodating. "NOTE" they have the best black out system i've ever seen. Their blackouts are actually shutteres and block any streak of sunlight into the room. It could be midday outside and you'd have no idea. Absolutely Fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Average+ hotel, good service.”
Reviews.Author: Norway77
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Radisson, in part because we had some Eurobonus points to burn. Getting to the hotel from the airport was no problem and cost approx 70 AED. Check-in was a loooong wait - despite that we had communicated with the hotel a week in advance about our hope for an early check-in we waited 4 hours to get into our room. Getting a shower in the spa area was no problem and service was great, but it would have been better to be told the check-in was not possible and we could have just headed out. Finally into the room we gave up waiting for our luggage to be delivered and wen back to fetch it - anoying to see the luggage guys just hanging out obviously not being told to deliver. Room was small but adequate, only equipped for 1 guest though so we kept having to ask for additional towers and glasses. The mini-bar was out of order so no use in cooling our wine there. Roomservice was quick to provide a bucket of ice upon request through. Staff was friendly and alwways ready with a "good morning" no metter what they were doing. No noticable noise from the bars or outside traffic was a huge pluss. We were happy on the roof-top bar, the pool was small but fine for cooling off and less hassle than going to the beach. Shuttle to the malls worked nicely. Breakfast was fine, we were not so impressed with the italian Cetro restaurant everyone is raving about. Two tasteless dishes (lasagna and ravioli) and a somewhat uninspired staff. Loungebar was loud and open for smokers, so we had a beer and hurried out. We had a massage at the spa which was also ok. Location is nice, close to the beach and Dubai marina - you need to take a taxi basically anywhere you want to go, but these are cheep and you can cut a deal with the hotel drivers. So- the hotel is ok- nothing more, nothing less. Being from Scandinavia it is below what we are used to from a SAS hotel. Only reason not to recommend this hotel to a friend is the price, for a business hotel it will do fine.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations delivered!”
Reviews.Author: Eddysson
Reviews.Content: We returned to Dubai after 2 years from our last visit. Couple of words about Dubai: looking forward to visit some dear friends that live there we were also curious to see how the city looks like since last time when it was a true mess, a complete construction site everywhere… Well, stunning! Has become such a beautiful place to visit, a mixture of European style (trees, flowers everywhere, small coffee shops…), Arabic architecture and 21st century technology! Witnessing also the Burj Khlaifa inauguration is, I believe, enough said… Dubai, hat off! We stayed at The Radisson Blu Media City and has proven to be a good choice. Location is convenient (easy to reach for a reasonable fee via taxi any place in Dubai) and the rooms are well appointed (great wi-fi connection and Anne Semonin amenities) despite the fact that are quite small. Fair enough though for the Hotel type, mainly business. The staff is indeed following the company’s statement “Yes, I can!” and we couldn’t find any fault to the service: friendly, prompt & most important genuinely happy to assist you. Food is of very good quality; try the brunch and the sushi corner! We also chose to order room service one evening and our request was smoothly processed from the ordering moment to the delivery time. Thank you to the Laundry department! I had an urgent need of a shirt being washed & pressed and the feeling was that I only closed to door behind me after being sent and an instant later I had to open it back to have it delivered! Amazing, well done guys! Overall, don’t choose to stay over expecting that you will have a great leisure time (even if there is a pool on the roof top is the size of a plunge pool; they also have a Spa onsite – didn’t try it though …) but the Hotel delivers what its purpose is: a very welcoming environment away from home, for a short to medium long stay and especially if staying in contact with your business partners is important. Will truly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Rendevouz with Media City”
Reviews.Author: Davids86
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the RD Blu Media City - and despite all other high-end properties in Dubai, this remains my favourite. The location, in quiet, non-bustling Media City combined with the carefully detailed design of the hotel makes it perfect for business or leisure, and the staff is great! I often travel to this hotel with friends who also visit Dubai often, and we all agree. This is a perfect choice! Although save yourself the extra expense of upgrading to business class. (every sales manager at the hotel will hate me for writing this) The standard rooms are fantastic and quite similar to Business Class. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best service I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Mar_Sam_Jo
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in my whole life. I was booked at the business room which was great by all means. very comfortable, very clean, very friendly staff, free internet, quick check in and check out. you can basically get anything you need in this hotel. The only downside I would say that the spa was not that good, i've experienced better massages in other hotels. But overall this is still one of the best hotels ever. I would definitly come back again when travelling on business and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: LebanonLittle
Reviews.Content: good hotel for business travelers only.i wouldnt reccomend it for peoplr traveling for vacation or luxury

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper better options close by -would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Smiley_Richard
Reviews.Content: Good points - free internet and location handy for business in Media City Negatives - Room is very small and feels pokey, decor is very 70s will faux leather, scratched MDF furtniture and looking a past its sell by date. Expect the same as a Uk motorway IBIS near Watford gap. Nearby hotels offering rooms 40% cheaper on www.dubai-bookings.com

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Iceman26
Reviews.Content: I often travel to Dubai on business trips. I have had a chance to stay in many hotels in the Marina and Jumeira side and I must say Radisson Blu in the Media City has been one of my favorites as a business traveler. The service is prompt and friendly, that is what you need on a business trip, things need to happen fast and they do. I also had one of the best Iftars (breaking fast) at the hotel last Ramadan. Definitely recommended! However, on certain occasions I found the bathrooms in the Standard room to have a drainage problem, I hope they would correct this ASAP as it was quite troublesome during my last stay! I would take that as an exception and forgive them for it this time!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Enoikos
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel if you are in Dubai for business. Extremely helpful staff and an excellent business center that I used for a series of on-site "informal" meetings. Free of charge broadband Internet, non-smoking pleasant room and a comfy bed. In-room dining due to my very late arrival was prompt and the dishes were very good. I will definetely stay there again on my next business trip due to the proximity to my client, the facilities for business travellers and the smiley helpful staff and service. Nevertheless, there is room for improvement and I am listing some minor findings. Breakfast is good but could definetely get better (e.g. increase cheese variety, more frequent fill-up, extend serving after 10:00 that buffet is abruptley closed etc). Hot dishes should not be so over-cooked. Air-conditioning output facade in room was dirty with black mud stains which was spoiling the overall very good atmosphere, making you feeling worried about filtering conditions. Low pressure fixed shower head, while in similar rated hotels a half-size bath-tub or a hydro-jet column is considered standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: fuds11
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a business trip for 4 days. It was comfortable & convenient. We enjoyed good customer service & other facilities like Wifi, Telephone, parking service, etc

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, recommend it”
Reviews.Author: almoghamis
Reviews.Content: all things fine here service, staff, resturent and all.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good, clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Klillrose
Reviews.Content: I found the Radisson to be a very enjoyable stay! The hotel had only just opened when i stayed, so the whole hotel was very clean and modern, the staff was helpful and friendly and i found all the restaurants to be quite good! A taxi ride to the marina or shopping, but good location for my company's office. Felt area was safe and clean too, walking distance to other restaurants and overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a Radisson.”
Reviews.Author: GoonerPB
Reviews.Content: Not a good location for a beach holiday, but fine for business in Media or Internet City. Room was fairly standard sized and clean, nice shower in bathroom. I didn't sample in hotel restaurants, but seemed to be fairly popular with non residents arriving to eat. Spa looked good but I didn't use it. Hotel has 2 small pools, great for a business trip, but wouldn't recommend as a holiday hotel. Taxis are plentiful and cheap so I used these to get around. Taxi to Burj Dubai Tower was around £10, Dubai Marina around £3. Mall of the Emirates is close too. Free wireless internet was a bonus as looked fairly expensive in other Dubai hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Satissa
Reviews.Content: Our Dubai office moved from Downtown to Jumeirah Media City. SAS Radisson is the next convienient hotel for business traveller. Professional and very friendly check-in. Enjoyed business rooms with inside and outdoor lounge. Due to ecomonic slowdown, air becomes better in Dubai, less construction, less cars. Internet is free, so no hidden business costs. Live Music events were going on, although it was no Jazz but old fashioned Rock music it did not bother. The hotel has two towers. I stayed in the one with the main entrance and there was absolutely no problem with the terrace bar. I did never experience any noise . The terrace is a beautiful spot to relax and music is accordingly. Staff is friendly but not at an equal level. As everywhere, Asian staff is outstanding. The other staff should take their behavior as best practice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Legionella84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. The hotel rooms vere elegant and classy, the bedsheets sooo comfy, the staff helpful, the breakfast delicious, there is really nothing to complain about. And even the walls weren't as thin as they stated before. Yes, surely there is a rooftop bar, and you can hear the music in your room, but they play nice music, and it's really not that loud. The only strange thing was though that they asked for AED 300 as deposit, but then they returned it back safely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nyheim
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Very new and modern, with the nicest rooms I've seen in a long time in a Radisson hotel. The hotel is located in nice surroundings by a nice park and small cafés. The staff was very helpful and professional. This is not a hotel for large familes, more for businessmen and couples. One of the downsides is that the hotel is not so very sentral to the city centre of Dubai, but still, it's very near Burj Al Arab, Ibm Batutta, Mall of Emirates, The Jumeirah Palm and a some very nice public beaches. 30 min drive to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice roof top bar”
Reviews.Author: pemaki
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night after 4 nights at the 4 points sheraton. The hotel is conveniently located in Dubai Media City and close to all major companies in DIC and KV. We booked an executive room with lounge access - the room was good sized and the lounge with complimentary food and beverages is highly recommended. The pool on one of the towers was really nice and temperature controlled. On the other tower they have the roof top terrace - which was really nice, though the "tapas" were not that spanish. :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hote, great bar!”
Reviews.Author: jddssc121
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 1 week on business, walking distance to many of the corporations in Media City. The rooms are ok. not huge, but not cramped. The hotel restaurant food is average. The best part about the hotel is the outdoor bar on the roof. gorgeous view, usually packed after 9pm. Room was kept clean, staff was polite. No major problems to report I would stay here again on business, but would look to a beach front hotel if i was on Holiday...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevertje
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen because our Dubai office was nearby. It's a great hotel with enough luxury to make it a pleasant stay. Only big negative thing I experienced during my stay is; noise of the bar upstairs. I had a room just one floor down. I complained few times and finally they lowered the volume of the music. (at 2AM) Good for me cause I had a very early flight day before and stayed up all day. They booked the Safari tour for me which was really great.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Dubai Media City
HotelInfo.Address: PO Box 211723, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
